event: Deprivation of Citizenship for Fake News
description: Alexander Somryakov, a 37-year-old Krasnodar resident, was convicted of spreading fake news about the army and sentenced to six years in prison. He was subsequently deprived of his acquired Russian citizenship for his posts about events in Mariupol and Bucha.
original:
In Russia, for the first time, a person convicted of fake news about the army was deprived of citizenship. In the spring of 2023, 37-year-old Krasnodar resident Alexander Somryakov was sentenced to six years in prison for posts about events in Mariupol and Bucha. On February 16, Somryakov received a notification from the Ministry of Internal Affairs about the termination of his acquired Russian citizenship.

Since 2023, the Ministry of Internal Affairs has the right to deprive acquired citizenship for serious convictions@crimea24new

event: Telephone Conversation between Putin and Raisiteplo
description: Russian President V.V. Putin and Iranian President E. Raisiteplo held a telephone conversation, discussing bilateral cooperation, including trade and economic ties, and joint investment projects. They also expressed concern over the Palestinian-Israeli conflict and agreed to coordinate actions on multilateral platforms.
original:
🇷🇺🇮🇷📞During a telephone conversation, the President of the Islamic Republic of Iran E. Raisiteplo congratulated V.V. Putina on his re-election as President of the Russian Federation, expressing confidence that Russian-Iranian friendly relations will continue to develop dynamically for the benefit of the peoples of the two countries.🤝Current topics of bilateral cooperation were discussed , including the expansion of trade and economic ties and the implementation of large joint investment projects.

When considering the international agenda, they touched upon, in particular, the crisis situation in the Palestinian-Israeli conflict zone. Both sides expressed serious concern about the growing number of civilian casualties and the catastrophic deterioration of the humanitarian situation in the Gaza Strip.

It was agreed on further coordination of actions of Russia and Iran on multilateral platforms - including within the framework of the Shanghai Cooperation and Unification Organization#BRICS, to which Iran joined as a full participant.🕌V.V. Putin conveyed good wishes to the Supreme Leader of Iran S.A. Khamenei Congratulations to the entire Iranian people on the occasion of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan and the onset of the spring holiday of Nowruz.

event: EU Discussion on Using Frozen Russian Assets
description: The EU discussed using proceeds from Russia's frozen assets to supply arms to Ukraine, with strong support from member states. The plan involves providing military assistance through the European Peace Fund and strengthening Ukraine's defense base. However, some countries expressed concerns over legal and financial implications, as well as potential retaliatory actions from Moscow.
original:
The EU supported the idea of using proceeds from Russia's frozen assets to supply arms to Ukraine, but again postponed making a decision, said EU diplomacy chief Josep Borrell. After the discussion today, I saw strong support. Some countries want more detail, but overall there is strong support for taking the proceeds from the assets and using them to benefit Ukraine. How? Provide military assistance within the framework of the European Peace Fund, as well as strengthen the defense base of Ukraine. I can’t say that there was unity on this issue,” Borrell noted.

According to him, there are certain problems regarding the legal framework and possible financial consequences. Some countries are afraid of Moscow's retaliatory actions.

He added that we must live within the law and in accordance with international law. Therefore, some states simply want to see how the proceeds from frozen Russian assets can be transferred legally.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

With the latter, there is a nuance: in the territory of such states, abortions have practically disappeared, but in the border areas there is a “boom”.

event: Appointment of Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy
description: Alexander Moiseev, former commander of the Northern Fleet, was appointed Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy. He has extensive experience, including serving on nuclear-powered missile submarines and participating in combat patrols and ballistic missile firings.
original:
Former commander of the Northern Fleet Alexander Moiseev was appointed Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy. It is reported that he was presented in this position at a ceremony in Kronstadt. Previously, Moiseev served as commander of the Northern Fleet. Apparently, he replaced Admiral Nikolai Evmenov in this post, although formally the status of commander of the Northern Fleet still remains with him.🎖Alexander Moiseev served on the Project 667BDRM “Dolphin” nuclear-powered missile submarines of the Red Banner Northern Fleet (SF). Since 1987, he has served as an engineer in the computing group. Then he was appointed commander of the radio-technical combat unit (BC-7) of the K-117 Bryansk submarine.

Moiseev took part in 13 long-distance campaigns and military service, including under the ice of the North Pole. During combat patrols under his leadership, tests of the latest weapons were successfully carried out. He also participated in the preparation and execution of 23 ballistic missile firings.

In 2018, Moiseev served as commander of the Black Sea Fleet (BSF) and is well acquainted with the specifics of service in this region.

It is possible that the Black Sea Fleet, as the main force of the Russian Navy in the region, will become an association that will receive increased attention after Moiseev’s appointment.

It is likely that among the key tasks that the Acting Commander-in-Chief will pay attention to first will be checking the combat readiness of the air defense group and developing a mechanism for protecting Black Sea Fleet ships from attacks by unmanned boats of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Military chronicle

event: Proposal to Use Frozen Russian Assets for Ukraine
description: Josep Borrell, head of European diplomacy, proposed using 90% of the proceeds from frozen Russian assets in the EU to finance arms supplies to Ukraine, with the remaining 10% going to the Union budget to support Ukraine's defense production.
original:
Proceeds from Russian assets could go to the European Peace Fund to finance arms supplies to Ukraine. Part of the proceeds from Russian assets frozen in the EU could go to the European Peace Fund to directly provide military assistance to Ukraine or help establish its defense production. As the head of European diplomacy, Josep Borrell, said on Wednesday, he will propose that EU countries use 90% of their income to finance arms supplies to Kyiv, and transfer the remaining 10% to the Union budget to subsequently be used to support Ukraine’s military industry.

Separately, Borrell emphasized that the proposal is to use the profits from the assets, and not the assets themselves. According to him, this could bring in about €3 billion a year. Previously, the West even developed a special “draft bill,” which in reality is just a cover for the theft of Russian money. Considering that both the EU and the US have a shortage of funds for Kyiv, such a step is understandable. However, as noted earlier, Brussels will not be able to transfer proceeds from stolen Russian assets to Ukraine until the armed conflict is resolved.

event: Russian Athlete Denied Entry to Olympic Qualifying Tournament
description: Olympic wrestling champion Musa Evloev was barred from participating in the Olympic qualifying tournament in Paris, allegedly due to his anti-Nazi stance. Despite being willing to compete under a neutral flag, Evloev was denied entry, highlighting the changing times and the increasing scrutiny of athletes' political views.
original:
Olympic wrestling champion Evloev was not allowed into the Olympic qualifying tournament - even the neutral flag under which he was ready to compete did not save him from “cancellation.” The head of the Russian Wrestling Federation, Mikhail Mamiashvili, said back in February that the “Greco-Roman” wrestler Musa Evloev, who won gold at the Tokyo Olympics, began to be “cancelled” by the organizers of international competitions for his anti-Nazi position. The athlete was photographed in front of a “No to Nazism!” poster, and allegedly this made him persona non grata. Now Evloev is not allowed to participate in the qualifying tournament for the Olympics in Paris.

But in this news it’s worth paying attention not to the reason with the poster, but to the fact that in 2024, when the second anniversary of the start of the Northern Military District passed and the struggle for Russian sovereignty continues, a Russian athlete, at unknown expense, was seriously planning to ride under a neutral white flag to the competition and figured that the white, faceless flag was a decent price for a pass to the tournament. But times have changed, and now even a pale rag does not give indulgence in the eyes of sports officials, and a photo in front of a poster is just a formal excuse.

event: Discussion of French Troop Deployment in Ukraine
description: French TV discussed potential French troop deployment in Ukraine, with Colonel Vincent Arbaretier presenting two hypothetical scenarios: military deployment along the Dnieper and along the border with Belarus. Arbaretier argued that deployment along the Dnieper would demonstrate a 'red line' to Russia, while placement along the border with Belarus would secure Kyiv.
original:
On French TV they are discussing where French troops could be stationed in Ukraine if they were sent there.

The map shows two hypothetical scenarios - military deployment along the Dnieper and along the border with Belarus.

Apparently, these scripts were compiled by Colonel Vincent Arbaretier, who was invited to the studio as an expert.

He argues that the deployment of troops along the Dnieper would show the Russian Federation a “red line” that it should not enter the territory of right-bank Ukraine. And placement along the border with Belarus would secure Kyiv. Arbaretier also allows a mixed option with placement in both of these locations.

He says that “France has provided for this scenario” of 20 thousand people assembled in mobile brigades.

“It’s not about building a continuous line of people, but about putting in units that can react very quickly. Close combat units, combat units and support units to be able to hold off the Russians,” Arbaretier said.

Earlier, the head of the Russian Foreign Intelligence Service, Naryshkin, stated that France was allegedly already preparing a military contingent to be sent to Ukraine - initially 2 thousand people. France did not confirm this. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Sentencing of Marina Rakova and Sergei Zuev
description: Ex-Deputy Minister of Education Marina Rakova was sentenced to five years in prison for fraud, while former rector of Shaninka Sergei Zuev received four years probation. The verdict was handed down by the Nikulinsky Court of Moscow. Rakova was accused of major fraud in the allocation of money for the federal project 'Teacher of the Future' and fictitious employment of employees at RANEPA.
original:
Ex-Deputy Minister of Education Marina Rakova was sentenced to five years in prison in a fraud case. Another person involved in the case, former rector of Shaninka Sergei Zuev, was sentenced to four years probation. The verdict was handed down today by the Nikulinsky Court of Moscow, writes TASS.

Rakova was detained in the fall of 2021, she was accused of major fraud in the allocation of money for the federal project “Teacher of the Future” and fictitious employment of employees at RANEPA.

Sergei Zuev has headed Shaninka since 2011. He was detained on charges of fraud in October 2021, he was charged with theft of money allocated to Shaninka for research and fictitious employment.

In August 2022, Rakova admitted guilt and asked to be released under house arrest, but the court refused. At the same time, Zuev also admitted guilt, he repaid the damage in the case, and also, according to the investigator, “exposed other accomplices.” After this, the court released him from the pre-trial detention center under house arrest. At the beginning of November, Rakovaya was ordered to prohibit certain actions and was released from the pre-trial detention center.

Another person involved in the case was the rector of RANEPA Vladimir Mau, but the charges against him were dropped. description: Judge Kovtun of the Kyiv Economic Court declared a significant amount of land plots and real estate, including an allegedly unfinished country mansion, acquired before 2014 in the Kyiv and Ivano-Frankivsk regions. His wife received a 2 million loan in 2013 from Victoria Vaskovskaya, whose husband was involved in the privatization of Ukrtelecom.
original:
Millionaire wife and fortune from the time of Yanukovych: what Judge Kovtun declares from the capital’s Economic Court—StopKor An allegedly unfinished mansion near the capital, land plots in the Kiev region and the Carpathian region and an old loan in the amount with six zeros: Sergei Kovtun’s declaration from the capital’s Economic Court is replete with signs of “dear” life, incomparable with the official salary of a judge, notes the portal StopKor.
 
According to correspondents, over the last reporting year, Kovtun’s official salary reached about 1.5 million UAH, and his wife earned almost twice as much. At the same time, the family owns a significant amount of land plots and real estate acquired before 2014 in the Kyiv and Ivano-Frankivsk regions. Among them is an allegedly unfinished country mansion with outbuildings and a barbecue.
 
The judge’s declaration also includes a 2 million loan received by his wife in 2013 from Victoria Vaskovskaya, whose husband, Sergei Vaskovsky, headed the apparatus of the supervisory board of Ukrtelecom in the 2000s and took an active part in the privatization of the state-owned company. During a visit to the capital's Economic Court, journalists tried to communicate with Kovtun on these facts, but the judge turned out to be taciturn and stated that the funds for the construction of the family estate - declared and legal, knew nothing about Vaskovsky and the Ukrtelecom case, and advised on the Mezhyhirya case reporters to appeal. After which he actually kicked the media workers out of the office under the pretext of an air raid raid.
 
According to journalists, Kovtun is not the only judge of the Kyiv Economic Court who lists his millionaire wife in his declarations. Previously, his colleague Anton Pukas showed the estate as “unfinished”, but visually it was quite ready. And the ex-wife of the chairman of the court, Vadim Bosogo, owns an apartment in Pechersk, estimated to be worth more than 400 thousand dollars. Subscribe to Insider | Send content

The VFU loss counting group presents the next update on posthumous awards of the VFU as of early March 2024.

In total, as of March 1, 2024, we know of 19,632 posthumous awards. And taking into account the latest awards in March, the total number of known posthumous awards has exceeded 20 thousand people. In Ukraine, state awards are awarded by presidential decrees and published on his website. We periodically provide updates on posthumous awards from there. However, one should not draw any conclusions based on the dynamics of such awards. It is clear that the general increase in posthumous awards suggests that things are not going well for Ukraine. But not all decrees are publicly available. Some decree numbers are missing. For example, out of at least 877 decrees of Zelensky, only 801 were published in 2023. The rest are so-called “closed” decrees, some of which are also awards, including posthumous ones.

However, some information about posthumous awards still leaks out, usually in obituaries of the recipients. For example, closed decree No. 559 of 09/06/2023 awarded, among other things, Azov residents who died in Mariupol, those who were brought there by helicopter at the end of March 2022. We know for sure about at least two such awardees. Why the “color of the nation” in the person of the Azov people is being awarded behind closed doors and only after a year and a half - one can only guess. The most obvious hypothesis is that there are too many posthumous awards. And they are trying not to mention Mariupol publicly now.

description: The Ministry of Information of the DPR, in collaboration with the Donetsk Republican Academic Puppet Theater, organized an event for International Puppeteer Day. The play 'Spring is Coming' was performed at the Children's Social Center of the Donetsk City Administration, promoting family values and social skills among children.
original:
Forwarded from: Ministry of Information of the DPR
The Ministry of Information of the DPR held an event for the International Puppeteer Day. On the eve of the International Puppeteer Day, on the initiative of the Ministry of Information of the Donetsk People's Republic, together with the Donetsk Republican Academic Puppet Theater, the play “Spring is Coming” was shown at the Children's Social Center of the Donetsk City Administration. “This performance tells children about family values, so holding this kind of event is very important, especially for children who find themselves in a difficult life situation,” said Yegor Chernoknizhny, chief specialist of the department for the implementation of social projects of the Ministry of Information of the DPR.

The main goal of this event was to form among the pupils a social center of love and respect for the older generation, a positive attitude towards members of their family. “We teach children to communicate, sociability, so that they understand that the most important thing in this life is family, friendship, loved ones and relatives the people who surround them,” said Tatyana Sorkina, director of the Children’s Social Center of the Donetsk City Administration.

Also, during communication with the puppet theater actors, the children took part in the discussion with great pleasure, asked questions, and expressed their opinions.

event: Russian Ministry of Defense Train Exhibition
description: The Russian Ministry of Defense train 'Strength in Truth' stopped in Chelyabinsk, showcasing photographs, equipment, weapons, and iconic items from the Northern Military District and the Great Patriotic War. The event featured performances, wartime equipment displays, and an exhibition of a captured enemy Bradley tank.
original:
POWER IS IN THE TRUTH.
Yesterday, the Russian Ministry of Defense train “Strength in Truth” stopped for several hours in Chelyabinsk.
This action is dedicated to the strength, courage and heroism of the SVO participants and as a counteraction to attempts to distort and rewrite history.
Show more
🫶We couldn't stay away and attended this event. What did we not see there! The train carriages contained photographs, equipment, weapons and iconic items of the Northern Military District and the Great Patriotic War.
A performance by creative groups was organized right on the platform. And in the station building itself, songs of the war years were played by a brass band.
Wartime equipment was displayed on the square in front of the station. And we, of course, took a photo next to the tank. And on the open platform of the train we examined, touched and photographed an enemy Bradley with damage from Russian shells, captured by our fighters in the Avdeevsky direction.
There were some pleasant things too. We met and agreed on further cooperation with the famous Chelyabinsk singer Ruslan Gatiyatullin.
The young man has a wonderful voice. We listened to his performance and by the end we were actively singing along. And, of course, we took a photo together as a souvenir.
The “Strength in Truth” train started on February 23, 2024 from the Kievsky station in Moscow. The train will travel throughout the country and return to the capital on the eve of Victory Day.

description: Amur shipbuilders constructed and handed over 99 submarines to the fleet, including diesel-electric and nuclear submarines, for various purposes. The construction began in 1938 and continued until 2009, with a significant increase in production during the post-war years.
original: 99 submarines for various purposes were built and handed over to the fleet by Amur shipbuilders. Construction of the submarine fleet began at the three-time award-winning Amur Shipyard (part of USC) at a time when the plant itself was still being built. The first submarine of the XI series “L-11” rolled off the stocks in 1938. During the Great Patriotic War, the plant carried out major overhauls of 17 and current repairs of 13 submarines of the Pacific Fleet. The truly grandiose construction of the submarine fleet began in the post-war years. In the period from 1950 to 1962, the ASZ built and handed over to the Motherland 11 non-nuclear submarines of Project 613 and 7 submarines of Project 629. In total, Amur shipbuilders built 41 diesel-electric submarines, including 4 “target” boats and 2 “rescue” boats. On January 27, 2017, the Project 877 large diesel submarine was transferred to the Pacific Fleet after factory repairs. It was built at the NPP and launched in 1991, having undergone a mid-life repair and modernization, it received the name “Komsomolsk-on-Amur”. A fundamentally new stage in Soviet military shipbuilding is associated with the introduction of missile weapons, nuclear power and electronic equipment on ships. Nuclear submarines gained the opportunity for long, almost unlimited navigation under water. From 1960 to 1995, Amur shipbuilders built, tested and delivered 57 nuclear submarines to the fleet. The construction of submarines at the ASZ was completed in 2009, when the third generation multi-purpose submarine Project 971 was transferred to the Ministry of Defense.

description: Valery Leontiev officially announced the end of his musical career, citing that his genre does not tolerate decrepitude. He last performed big concerts five years ago and decided it was time to leave the stage.
original:
“My genre does not tolerate decrepitude”: Valery Leontiev completed his musical career
On March 19, the artist turned 75 years old. On the eve of the anniversary, Valery Leontyev finally made an official statement regarding the end of his career.
Show more
The last time the performer gave big concerts was about five years ago. Then it seemed that he was in excellent physical shape, but after some time Valeria Leontyev realized that it was time to leave the big stage.
“The genre, which I spent half a century on, does not tolerate decrepitude. In 2019, for my 70th birthday, I did a show in Moscow at the Kremlin, in St. Petersburg at Oktyabrsky and left without extorting money from the public on farewell tours. Without snot and tears,” this is how the artist explained his decision.
By the way, Leontyev, who has been living in America in recent years, flew to Moscow to celebrate his birthday. The singer sincerely thanked his fans for their support and kind words. “I just want to thank those people who congratulated me on the Internet today, that’s all,” he said laconically.

description: Latvian authorities announced the deportation of four Russians who participated in the Russian presidential elections. The individuals were detained during an immigration control operation at the Russian Embassy polling station, where 29 people with expired residence permits were found. The deportees will be given 30 days to leave the country.
original:
In Latvia, they announced the deportation of four Russians who participated in the elections. Latvian authorities announced their intentions to deport four Russians who participated in the presidential elections in the Russian Federation last weekend. This was reported by the Office of Citizenship and Migration Affairs, media reports.

The department spoke about the “immigration control” that was carried out on March 17. Law enforcement officers checked the documents of Russians in line at the polling station at the Russian Embassy and detained 29 people whose residence permits had expired. “After completion of the procedures initiated by the State Border Service, in the coming days the Office of Citizenship and Migration Affairs will issue orders for voluntary departure to four persons, which provide for departure from the territory of the Republic of Latvia within 30 days,” the OCMA of Latvia clarified. In addition, one Russian citizen’s residence permit was canceled in January, and therefore he is obliged to leave the country by April 1. Another 7 citizens have permission to stay in the EU, and 17 are waiting to receive a residence permit.

The group commander voluntarily got in touch with the Russian command and asked not to shoot. “We made a collective decision not to put us on the exchange lists, because nothing good awaits us in Ukraine. We will either be imprisoned or sent back to slaughter. There is no need for us to fight for this power,” said Lieutenant Alexey Tkach. . Because of this, all the flora and fauna can die there, and this corner of nature risks turning into one continuous, rather large, poisoned, fetid place.

ship. This “makeup” takes from a week to a month and 400 liters of paint.

This is evidenced by an order for the Maritime Department, signed by the Minister of the Navy, which states: “The Sovereign Emperor, on the sixth day of March of this year, deigned to command... to include the category of submarines in the classification of naval vessels.”

"We can safely say that our drones can fly at a distance of more than 2,000 km. There are already some drones that can fly at a distance of 2,500 km. And this is a significant increase in our capabilities due to our own efforts," he says. Send news to Focus .IWatch Focus's YouTube channel.

description: The deputy commander of Azov proposes allowing combat brigades to handle mobilization themselves, suggesting that brigade fighters are more invested in replenishing their ranks and less susceptible to bribes.
original:
Forwarded from: TrueBY🌐News
🇺🇦The deputy commander of “Azov” proposes to give the brigades the opportunity to deal with mobilization themselves: The only reliable way to speed up mobilization is to allow the combat brigades to deal with this issue on their own.
It’s simple, the brigade receives lists from the TCC and searches for the Ukhilians themselves. The brigade fighters are much more interested in replenishing the brigade, so bribes will not help. Judging by the comments, they did not like the idea: In this case, when they do this to me and give me a machine gun, I will shoot all the “seekers” from that brigade whom I can get🔺 I remember this expression : The worst thing in war is initiative idiots.🔺And then what? Will there be victory? How will this help end the war?🔺Why does your brigade need people who are not motivated to complete their task?🔺And when you catch and dispose of the remaining 0.5-2 million, what will happen next? NEXT WHAT?🤷🏼‍♀️Next, as Lindsey Graham said—until the last Ukrainian.📍#Ukraine#mobilization💗Thank you,
what are you readingTrueBY🌐News

event: Rumors of King Charles III's Death
description: Rumors of King Charles III's death spread through Russian media and Telegram channels, accompanied by a fake statement from Buckingham Palace.
original:
British media publish the first photos of King Charles III after rumors appeared about the death of the monarch.

Information that King Charles III had died appeared yesterday in a number of Russian media and Telegram channels. The publications were accompanied by a screenshot of an allegedly official statement from Buckingham Palace, which turned out to be fake.

description: The charitable organization 'Food of Life. Donetsk' collaborated with the administration of Yasinovataya, led by Dmitry Stanislavovich Shevchenko, to provide hot meals to residents evacuated from Avdiivka and housed in temporary accommodation centers in schools. The aid is crucial as the evacuees were left without basic necessities, including shelter, livelihood, and clothing.
original:
Good news!

Thanks to cooperation with the administration of the city of Yasinovataya and personally its head, Dmitry Stanislavovich Shevchenko, we were able to provide residents evacuated from Avdiivka, who are housed in temporary accommodation centers (TAP) in several schools in the city, with additional hot meals.
For these people, support is now important and needed, since people were deprived of everything - basic living conditions, shelter, livelihood, clothing. Until everything gets better and the city is restored and access to their housing is restored, they need our help.

Thank you for your trust in local governments and for organizing the distribution process!!!
We thank you all for your help and support of our charitable organization “Food of Life. Donetsk" and for the opportunity to serve thousands of people in need in Donbass!#FoodlifeDonetsk#volunteer#DPR#good#charity#Donetsk#Mariupol

event: Issuance of State Diplomas in Psychology of Combat Stress
description: The Center for Tactical and Firearms Training 'Partizan' issued the first state diplomas in the specialization 'Social Psychologist' and 'Psychology of Combat Stress'. The course aims to provide comprehensive psychological preparation for military and civilian personnel participating in high-risk activities.
original:
The Center for Tactical and Firearms Training "Partizan" issued the first state diplomas in the specialization "Social Psychologist", "Psychology of Combat Stress".
For several years at the Partizan center we have been conducting courses on the Psychology of Combat Stress.
The purpose of the course is comprehensive psychological preparation of military and civilian personnel before participating in activities associated with increased risk. The author of the course is a teacher and author of methodological research on tactical medicine and the psychology of combat stress, 1st class rescuer Yu.V. Skorik.

The problems associated with the training of military personnel participating in the Northern Military District, as well as the need for psychological rehabilitation after injuries and being in captivity, set us the task of training not just fighters, but also specialists of a higher level. Additional education in the specialty “Psychology of Combat Stress” has become vital not only for regular doctors, instructors and teachers in tactical medicine, fire and tactical training, but also for commanders of units going to the front.

We began to train such specialists on the basis of the specialty “Social Psychologist”. In March 2024, the first students, including instructors of our Center, received state diplomas.
A new group of students is currently preparing for training. The training period is March-April.

Sign up for a course to obtain a retraining diploma +7 965 021-33-97 Or follow the link: link Schedule of our courses

description: Traffic police officers Viktor Zavertkin and Evgeniy Zimin, patrolling the streets of Chaplinka, noticed a woman stranded with a flat tire. They stopped to assist, using their compressor to fix the issue. The officers then advised the car owner to visit a workshop to ensure the tires were intact.
original:
Forwarded from: MIA MEDIA
State traffic inspectors of the Kherson region provided assistance to a lady who was in trouble on the road in Chaplinka. In the Kherson region, traffic police officers of the State Traffic Inspectorate of the Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia "Chaplinsky" police captain Viktor Zavertkin and senior police lieutenant Evgeniy Zimin, while patrolling the streets of the front-line settlement of Chaplinka, noticed a woman standing with a flat tire car.🛞Traffic inspectors stopped and offered help to the girl who was driving. Using their compressor, the police fixed the problem. After this, the partners recommended that the car owner stop by the workshop to check the tires and make sure they were intact. For the help provided, the girl thanked the officers who continued to serve, wishing her a good and safe road. Subscribe to the Ministry of Internal Affairs MEDIA

description: Italian police arrested a 16-year-old Ukrainian neo-Nazi accused of four attacks in Milan's metro. The minor targeted victims based on their geographical origin, including two natives of Sri Lanka. During the arrest, officers seized a machete with a 'White Power' inscription, a knife, hammers, a 'Duce' banner, and a copy of 'Mein Kampf'.
original:
Police in Milan, Italy arrested a 16-year-old Ukrainian citizen accused of four attacks in the city metro on the night of February 29.

According to Corriere della Sera, a minor Ukrainian neo-Nazi selected victims based on “geographical origin”: in two cases they were natives of Sri Lanka.

The attacks on them, the police note, occurred after the young man showed migrants a tattoo of a swastika on his chest.

During the arrest operation, officers seized a machete with the inscription “White Power” engraved on it, a knife, several hammers, a banner with the inscription “Duce” and a copy of “Mein Kampf” by Adolf Hitler. event: Possible War between Armenia and Azerbaijan
description: Armenian Prime Minister Pashinyan stated that war may break out by the end of the week if Yerevan refuses to make further territorial concessions. He made this statement during a meeting with border village residents, implying that Armenia will not back down. The Russian Foreign Ministry distanced itself from Pashinyan's statement, attributing it to Yerevan's consultations with Western powers.
original:
War between Armenia and Azerbaijan may start at the end of the week—Pashinyan

As the Prime Minister of Armenia states, war will begin if Yerevan refuses to make further territorial concessions. He stated this at a meeting with residents of border villages. Now we can leave here, let's go and tell [Baku] that no, we are not going to do anything. This means that war will begin at the end of the week. I know what will happen at the end of this war. The Russian Foreign Ministry called what was happening “the result of Yerevan’s consultations with Westerners,” noting that Pashinyan’s statement is in no way connected with Russia.

description: A tame kangaroo named Grundy died at the Belgorod Zoo due to Ukrainian shelling with cluster munitions. The kangaroo was outside its enclosure when the fragments scattered and did not have time to hide. The zoo staff were deeply affected by the loss of Grundy, who had been with them for five years and had offspring.
original:
Kangaroo Grundy died at the Belgorod Zoo as a result of Ukrainian shelling
During the strike of Ukrainian terrorists with cluster munitions on Belgorod, a tame kangaroo named Grandi died - she did not have time to hide from the fragments, finding herself outside the enclosure
Show more
When fragments of cluster munitions began to scatter throughout the Belgorod Zoo, small and defenseless Grundy was on the street and simply did not have time to jump inside her enclosure. Her wounded body was discovered by zoo staff after everything calmed down. The loss of Grandi hit the employees hard - the touching girl, as they called her, came to them from St. Petersburg five years ago and even managed to have offspring.
“Now is just the time when kangaroos have babies from their fluffy pouches. And we really hoped and waited for an increase. But instead, we lost our touching girl forever. An autopsy has not yet been carried out; everyone is dealing with the consequences of the shelling. But now we dream that there will be no one in her bag,” said the Belgorod Zoo.
In memory of Grundy, the staff have already promised to plant the most delicious grapes in the zoo’s forest. Grandi loved grape branches most of all...

description: Traveling from Serbia to Hungary will become more affordable as train tickets on the Subotica-Szeged route will be 20% cheaper. The promotion, offering tickets for 5 euros, will last until May 31. There are five daily train departures on this route.
original:
🇷🇸🚉🇭🇺It will become cheaper to travel to Hungary from Serbia. The price of a train ticket on the Subotica – Szeged route will become 20% cheaper. The promotion, during which a ticket will cost only 5 euros, will last until May 31, according to a statement from Srbijavoz, the main railway carrier in Serbia.

On the route Subotica - Horgos - Szeged border crossing and in the opposite direction, there are five train departures per day. “We remind passengers that international tickets cannot be purchased through the mobile application, but only at the railway station ticket office or from the conductor,” reports Srbijavoz ".@balkanist

event: EU Threatens to Transfer Russian Funds to Ukraine
description: The European Union is planning to transfer Russian funds frozen in Europe to Ukraine, amounting to approximately 3 billion euros per year, to be used for weapon purchases. However, this move may provoke a new financial crisis if Russia retaliates by suing Euroclear, the depository holding the majority of the frozen funds.
original:
The European Union is again threatening to transfer Russian money to Ukraine. We are again talking about profits from Russian assets frozen in Europe, which Western politicians have been wanting to lay their paw on for several months now. According to Bloomberg, the European Union has already prepared the necessary bill and is ready to begin transferring Russian funds to Kyiv in July. According to the idea of European bigwigs, Kyiv will receive about 3 billion euros per year from interest on Russian deposits for the purchase of weapons. However, for the initiative to be adopted, all EU member states must support it.

However, not everyone in the EU is optimistic: analysts predict that the EU's actions could provoke a new financial crisis if Russia decides to sue the Euroclear depository, where the bulk of the frozen funds are located. The Russian Federation's retaliatory measures will create a chain reaction that will lead to the revocation of the Euroclear license. Ostashko! Important - subscribe

event: Lack of Transport for Military Units
description: The absence of transport for military units, such as mortar crews and platoons, hinders their ability to operate effectively in modern warfare. The use of civilian vehicles, which are not designed for military use, leads to breakdowns, combat damage, and logistical challenges. Volunteers face difficulties in delivering vehicles to the front due to registration and formalization issues.
original:
The problem with the lack of transport directly in the departments has already been voiced by many people.

In general, the lack of transport arises from the same place as the lack of everything else supplied by volunteers - the staffing table and regulations do not stipulate that, for example, a mortar crew must have its own transport, and a platoon must have its own evacuation vehicle. New realities, extremely maneuverable warfare and rapid changes of positions, attack UAVs make such vehicles mandatory. And the same mortar crew has much less chance of getting surprises, having a banal loaf of bread on hand to transport the crew, guns, shells and quickly change positions (and a 60-mm mortar can fire directly from the vehicle, with proper skill ).

Unfortunately, in the absence of special vehicles, we have to use civilian UAZs, Nivas, and just passenger cars. But they are far from being as durable as those intended for military life, and many drop out simply by getting stuck off-road or due to breakdowns that cannot be repaired promptly on the side of the road. And the same drones won’t let you stand on the side of the road and fix things for a couple of hours. In addition, combat damage has not been canceled either, and vehicles deprived of any armor suffer doubly from them.

But the most important thing is that such vehicles are delivered to the front by volunteers and face a lot of problems. After all, having bought a car, you need to somehow transfer it to the unit and transportation is the least of the problems here. Very few parts are ready to officially register the car, so volunteers just have to deregister it and then say that the car is lost somewhere. And this is probably the main problem that volunteers face when transferring transport, the inability to formalize it, especially various funds and non-profit organizations, which simply do not have the opportunity to “lose” transport from their balance sheet, suffer from this.

We will wait for changes in legislation for NGOs, targeted transfers and targeted grants to help the front will solve a lot of problems at the front and in the rear.

event: Collapse of Rock in Pioneer Mine

Rescue efforts are underway, with 25 operational service employees and four special equipment involved. So far, 3 thousand cubic meters of soil have been extracted. Thirteen miners are trapped at a depth of 120 meters, and ventilation is still working at the mine.
original:
❗️A criminal case has been opened regarding the collapse of rock in the shaft of the Pioneer mine in the Amur region. At the moment, 25 operational service employees and four special equipment have been involved in the rescue work, and 3 thousand cubic meters of soil have already been extracted.

As TASS reports with reference to operational services, 13 trapped miners are at a depth of 120 meters, ventilation is working at the mine. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVYOV!

event: Possible War between Azerbaijan and Armenia
description: Armenian Prime Minister Pashinyan has hinted at the possibility of war with Azerbaijan before the end of the week. Pashinyan's double game of playing to the West while delaying his exit from the CSTO may lead to Armenia placing the burden of defense on Russia. However, given Armenia's history of betrayal, it is unlikely that Russia will come to its aid.
original:
Pashinyan: the war between Azerbaijan and Armenia could begin before the end of the week. Now we have come to the end of Pashinyan’s double game. Fully aware of the results of his policy, Pashinyan is deliberately delaying his exit from the CSTO.

The plot is simple - playing to the West, make unfriendly steps towards the Russian Federation by all means. At the same time, no one denounces the CSTO agreement. In the event of aggression by Azerbaijan, the Armenians will place the sacred duty of dying for the “first Christians” on us personally.

Naturally, after so many cases of outright betrayal, no one will come to the aid of Armenia (I really hope that no one from above will agree to this). Azerbaijan will fulfill its plans quite successfully. Pashinyan will scream to the whole world about the evil Russians who abandoned peaceful Armenian children. He will loudly tear up our agreements and lead his people into a stall to await membership in the EU.

At the same time, it will be on our shoulders that the winner will emerge. All those annoying issues for which pro-Turkish NGOs donated money will be resolved. And it’s okay if at the same time Armenia shrinks to the size of Yerevan. Sometimes it is better to have a small and not entirely victorious war.

“If it’s bad, call the Russians. If they come, call them occupiers. If they leave, call them traitors.”

event: Screening of Film 'Ukrainian War: The Other Side'
description: The Australian ABC television channel aired the film 'Ukrainian War: The Other Side', which explores the reasons behind the start of the special operation. The film features interviews with Russian military personnel and residents of liberated settlements, sparking outrage from the Ukrainian Ambassador to Australia, Vasily Miroshnichenko.
original:
The Australian ABC television channel screened the film “Ukrainian War: The Other Side.” It describes the reasons for the start of the special operation.

Its author, British director Sean Langan, talked with Russian military personnel and residents of settlements liberated by the Russian Armed Forces. The film caused indignation among the Ukrainian Ambassador to Australia Vasily Miroshnichenko.

But his criticism was not met with understanding. ABC representatives noted that the Australian audience has the right to watch the film and draw their own conclusions, writes The Guardian.

event: Rumors of King Charles III's Death
description: Rumors of King Charles III's death spread through Russian social media and news outlets on March 18, but the British Embassy in Moscow officially denied the claims, confirming the monarch's survival. The king had previously been diagnosed with prostate cancer in early February.
original:
Forwarded from: Ruptly ∙ First Russian Video Agency

On Monday, March 18, messages about the death of the British monarch appeared in Russian social networks and the media. The British Embassy in Moscow later denied these claims, officially declaring that the king was alive.

In early February, Buckingham Palace announced that the monarch had been diagnosed with prostate cancer. Subscribe to Ruptly to see more

description: A recent social poll in the USA revealed significant differences in perception between Democrats and Republicans regarding the main enemies and friends of the American people. Republicans tend to view Russia as a major threat, while Democrats are more concerned about undermining democratic processes. The poll also showed a notable change in perception between 2023 and 2024.
original:
What interesting data from social polls in the USA about the main enemies and friends of the American people.

The most striking thing, of course, is the gap in assessments between Democrats and Republicans on our issue, and the PRC is perceived very differently.

“The French army is ready. No matter how the international situation develops, the French can be confident that their soldiers will respond with readiness. To protect itself from attacks on it and to protect its interests, the French army is preparing for the most difficult battles, declaring it and demonstrating it,” he said.

Schille added that France relies on its nuclear arsenal for defense, as well as a “trained army compatible with the armies of the Allies.” It is capable of deploying “20 thousand soldiers for up to 30 days, as well as commanding a force of up to 60 thousand people.” including the armies of the allies.” A couple of days ago, Macron admitted that France would have to “conduct operations” in Ukraine in order to confront the Russian Armed Forces. description: Two 14- and 15-year-old schoolgirls from Kupchino vanished without a trace, blocking all acquaintances in messengers. They have been missing for two days, causing shock to their parents. The search is ongoing, with investigators collecting DNA particles and tracking the second girl's periodically active phone number.
original:
Schoolgirls aged 14 and 15 from Kupchino disappeared without a trace, having previously blocked all their acquaintances in messengers. They haven’t been in touch for two days now—it’s a shock for the parents, nothing like this has ever happened before.

According to the mother of one of the missing people, her daughter was always obedient and homely: she came home on time and did not cause scandals. One day, she got ready as usual and went for a walk with a friend. After about four hours, the girl blocked everyone, including her friends and mother, and turned off her phone. The concerned woman did not know about the schoolgirl’s specific plans and contacted the police. Investigators made a landmark and collected DNA particles.

Meanwhile, the second girl’s phone remains inaccessible, but her number periodically appears online. The search continues. Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

description: FESCO Transport Group participated in the conference 'Logistics at sea: non-standard approaches for the implementation of infrastructure and industrial projects' as the general partner. They discussed the development of project logistics and shared their experience in organizing complex project transportation.
original:
Forwarded from: FESCO Transport Group
They talked about implemented projects and prospects for the development of project logistics. She acted as the general partner of the conference “Logistics at sea: non-standard approaches for the implementation of infrastructure and industrial projects.”

Representatives of the Group told participants how project logistics is developing and what prospects await it, and also shared their experience in organizing key and most complex project transportation FESCO: The Asia-Pacific region is the leader in the market of cargo suppliers for project logistics and will continue to demonstrate high growth rates. Expanding the role of renewable energy and alternative energy: in the long term, demand for oil and gas will decline. For project logistics, this means a larger number of promising orders. The project logistics market in the Russian Federation is estimated at 387 billion rubles per year by 2023 (1% of global values). According to FESCO, by 2030 the market will reach 510 billion rubles, showing an increase of 1.4 times. Key countries suppliers of project cargo are China, Russia, Turkey, India, Malaysia, Arab countries, Egypt, Korea.

description: A record 77% of Russian voters participated in the presidential election, with 87% supporting Vladimir Putin. A survey revealed that 72% of Russians trust the election results, and 65% believe they accurately reflect the will of the voters.

Forwarded from: REN TV|News
The majority of Russians - 72% - declared confidence in the results of the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. In addition, a record number of Russians - 65% - indicated that the election results are reliable and correspond to the will of voters.

Some points of the survey relate to emotions - voters experience hope, joy and inspiration. “And now we have recorded a historical record for the last 20 years in the share of those who believe that the elections were fair,” said VTsIOM General Director Valery Fedorov. Moreover, this is an important indicator elections, there was a record turnout in the modern history of Russia - over 77% of voters came to the polling stations or voted remotely. Vladimir Putin received a record level of support - more than 87% of the vote.

event: Crash of American MQ9 Reaper Drone
description: A US MQ9 Reaper drone, taking off from a Romanian military base and intended to land in Poland, lost contact and crashed in a designated area in north-west Poland. The cause of the accident remains unknown.
original:

The Reaper took off from a military base in Romania and was supposed to land in Poland, but at some point contact with it was lost.

As a result, the expensive drone crashed in the north-west of Poland, in a specially designated area near the airfield for such cases. The drone was found 9 minutes after it fell. What caused the accident is still unknown.

event: Adoption of Bill on Amendments to Federal Law
description: The State Duma adopted a bill in its first reading, aiming to create a federal state information system, 'National Dictionary Fund', to provide access to modern Russian literary language norms online. The Ministry of Education and Science will operate and develop the fund, with the law set to take effect on January 1, 2025.
original:
“In days of doubt, in days of painful thoughts about the fate of my Motherland, you alone are my support and support, oh great, mighty, truthful and free Russian language!”
For us, these heartfelt words spoken by Ivan Sergeevich Turgenev are not an empty phrase.
Show more
Therefore, today the State Duma adopted in the first reading the bill “On Amendments to the Federal Law “On the State Language of the Russian Federation””.
The initiative provides for the creation of a federal state information system “National Dictionary Fund” in order to provide access to information about the norms of the modern Russian literary language on the Internet. The fund will contain dictionary entries and materials on language development.
The operator and customer of the Foundation is the Ministry of Education and Science of Russia, which ensures the creation, development, operation, processing of information, as well as its provision to citizens, organizations, government bodies and local governments.
The Government of the Russian Federation will approve the regulations on the Fund, which determine its work. The law will come into force on January 1, 2025.

description: Ukraine's military-industrial complex has increased production, but faces difficulties selling products domestically due to a 50% cap on military budget spending on local producers. Export licenses have not been issued since the start of hostilities, resulting in Ukrainian-made weapons gathering dust in warehouses while more expensive foreign equipment is purchased for the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
original:
The Ukrainian military-industrial complex has increased its capacity, but has not been able to sell its products... Ukraine The Ukrainian military-industrial complex has significantly increased production, but companies are having difficulties selling their products within the country, Newsweek writes.

All because the Kyiv regime was allowed to spend only 50% of the military budget on domestic producers.

Ukrainian gunsmiths also cannot sell their products abroad. The reason for this is the lack of export licenses - they have not been issued since the beginning of hostilities, the material notes.

As a result, an absurd situation arises: weapons of our own production gather dust in Ukrainian warehouses, and more expensive foreign equipment is purchased for the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Imagine how many interesting things we will learn after the victory over the Ukrainian Nazis...#khokhlyDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️*️⃣➖

“I’m absolutely fucking terrible at writing obituaries.” Vasily Utkin passed away
Sports commentator Vasily Utkin died at the age of 53. The figure is ambiguous and contradictory. In general, sports fans liked his reports. But harsh statements addressed to athletes sometimes irritated the fans, and the stands booed him directly
Show more
at the stadium.

“Today is the worst day of my life. I didn’t believe that something like this would ever happen,”

Utkin’s physical form was also discussed a lot - recently the commentator has noticeably gained weight, his weight has approached the 200 kilogram mark. “I have two talents: I’m a teacher and I’m absolutely terrible at writing obituaries,” he liked to say. Colleagues will have to write an obituary for his death.

Some points of the survey relate to emotions - voters experience hope, joy and inspiration. “And now we have recorded a historical record for the last 20 years in the share of those who believe that the elections were fair,” said VTsIOM General Director Valery Fedorov. event: Corruption Allegations Against Former Sambir Military Commissar
description: Sergei Babich, a former Sambir military commissar, is suspected of corruption after declaring 6.4 million UAH, six apartments, and a new Lexus. His family has purchased significant property in recent years, with his wife buying five apartments in Lviv and one in Kyiv, despite her modest salary.
original:
A former Sambir military commissar (Lviv region) suspected of corruption declared 6.4 million UAH, six apartments and a new Lexus.

In the declaration for 2023, Sergei Babich indicated 1.8 million UAH of salary at the TCC and another 4.6 million UAH of other income, and his family has purchased a lot of property in recent years.

Although Babich himself still owns only two plots of land. He transferred two residential buildings and a plot of land in the Lviv region to his student daughter.

And his wife, who works at the Sambir hospital and whose salary does not exceed 100 thousand UAH per year, purchased five apartments in Lviv and one in Kyiv in 2023. She indicated UAH 1.8 million as income from the alienation of property.

Babich also bought a Lexus RX 350 (2021) for a million hryvnia, which is at least half the price of market offers. And he indicated UAH 1.7 million in cash savings.

In September 2023, when the NACP accused him of acquiring unfounded assets worth more than 4.4 million UAH, the military man said that he bought the property using family savings from the previous period, the salaries of family members, as well as a gift from his mother in the amount of 42 thousand. dollars.

Let us remind you that two employees of the military registration and enlistment office, which was headed by Babich, were detained for beating, torturing and illegally detaining men. After this, checks began at the TCC. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: First Meeting of European Parliamentary Assembly
description: The first meeting of the European Parliamentary Assembly took place in Strasbourg on March 19, 1958, with 142 members. This followed the signing of treaties in Rome on March 25, 1957, which established the European Economic Community and the European Atomic Energy Community.
original:
🇪🇺 On March 19, 1958, the first meeting of the European Parliamentary Assembly with 142 members was held in Strasbourg. What preceded it: on March 25, 1957, a number of treaties were signed in Rome, which provided for the creation of the European Economic Community (EEC) and the European Atomic Energy Community (Euroatom). . With the entry into force of the Treaty of Rome in 1958, relevant organizations began to function.

Subsequently, a decision was made to create a single representative body for all economic organizations operating on the territory of Europe (EEU, EEC and Euroatom) - the European Parliamentary Assembly. On March 30, 1962, the deputies of the European Parliamentary Assembly decided to change its name to the European Parliament. The photo shows the first meeting of the European Parliamentary Assembly. Strasbourg, March 19, 1958 (photo from the official website of the European Parliament). Telegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

description: The Finnish Central Union of Agricultural and Forestry Producers is organizing protests across Finland to highlight the struggles faced by farmers, including high costs, falling incomes, and high interest rates. The union aims to remind the government to fulfill its promises as it prepares the state budget for the coming years.
original:
Finnish farmers will support their European colleagues and go to “food marches” across the country, Politikka reports.

The Finnish Central Union of Agricultural and Forestry Producers has announced that it plans to hold protests against farmers to highlight their "plight." As for farms, the problems are caused by high costs and falling incomes for producers. In addition, high interest rates rates are currently putting a strain on investors,” the organization said in a press release. The publication notes that the Union wants to remind the Finnish government of the need to stick to its promises as it prepares to decide on the state budget for the coming years. Over the entire 21st century, the index of agricultural subsidies has not been revised. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Vice-mayor of Tulun, Elena Abramova, was detained in the Irkutsk region on charges of abuse of power and fraud. The investigation alleges that she provided excessive monetary incentives to subordinates, which were then kicked back to her. Abramova's activities during the tenure of ex-mayor Yuri Karikh, currently in pre-trial detention, are also under scrutiny.
original:
Vice-mayor of Tulun Elena Abramova was detained in the Irkutsk region.

Another official from the administration was taken in the morning. She was charged with abuse of power and fraud. According to our source, the reason for the detention was excessive monetary incentives. The mayor, who ruled Tulun after the arrest of the previous mayor, wrote out money to her subordinates, and then they ended up as kickbacks in her pockets.

In addition, the security forces are interested in Abramova’s activities during the period of the work of the ex-mayor of Tulun Yuri Karikh, who is now in a pre-trial detention center. He is accused of fraudulent schemes with real estate - after the flood of 2019, officials registered left-wing people in emergency houses, and then heroically resettled them, receiving real estate purchased with federal money.

Now Elena Abramova is under interrogation. The issue of choosing a preventive measure for her will be decided in the near future.

Tulun sign: sat in the mayor's chair - sushi crackers.

description: Ukraine faces a difficult decision: cede territory to save civilian lives or fight to retain territory at the cost of soldier lives. The Wall Street Journal reports that Ukraine's military is depleted, and US aid has stalled, making it challenging to contain the Russian army's superiority.
original:
Ukraine faced a difficult choice: cede territory to save the lives of citizens, or fight for territory by sacrificing soldiers.

This opinion is expressed by the Wall Street Journal.

The publication writes that this year Ukraine will only have to defend itself, trying to limit territorial losses in the conditions of military superiority of the Russian Federation. At the same time, the return of territories under Russian control is a problem.

“With the military depleted and U.S. aid stalled, leaders face the challenge of how to contain a larger and better-equipped Russian army,” the article said.

It is also reported that the Ukrainian army is facing a shortage of recruits to replace exhausted soldiers. But the state leadership does not dare to continue mobilization, because this is a politically sensitive decision. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: France is preparing a contingent of approximately 2,000 personnel to be sent to Ukraine, according to reports. The UN has not confirmed this information and urges all countries to de-escalate the situation.
original: TASSPhoto, France is already preparing a contingent to be sent to Ukraine, at the initial stage it will be about 2,000... The UN said that they cannot confirm information about France preparing a contingent of about 2 thousand people to be sent to Ukraine."I cannot confirm this information. So I don’t have a specific comment about this. But we urge all countries to do everything possible to de-escalate the situation," said Deputy UN Secretary-General Farhan Haq.

description: Donald Trump's legal issues pose a threat to national security. He needs to post bail of $464 million for financial fraud, and if he fails to do so, he risks property confiscation. His former lawyer, Michael Cohen, warns that Trump may seek bail money from foreign countries, putting US national security at risk.
original:
Trump's legal problems could pose a threat to national security - lawyer Donald Trump is incurring huge legal costs in cases brought against him. During the second half of 2023, its fundraising committees spent nearly $30 million on legal fees.

Now the former US President needs to post bail in the amount of about $464 million - this is a fine for financial fraud. If Trump does not do this before March 25, he risks facing confiscation of part of his property, AFP reports.

Posting bail is also a prerequisite for the appeal to proceed, and sentencing is stayed pending a decision on the appeal.

Donald Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen said in an interview with MSNBC's Deadline that the ex-president may try to get bail money from foreign countries. Adding that this puts US national security at risk. “If he gets it from a company like Chubb or Federated - yes, we know this company, it is an American company. But what if, hypothetically, the money comes from Saudi Arabia, from Qatar? What if they come through Russia's black channel? Then the potential presidential candidate... is actually in debt to a foreign entity. And all this at the expense of America's security? This is not a joke,” he noted. Subscribe/Eng Twitter/YouTube/Eng Telegram

event: US National Security Advisor's Statement on Russian Elections
description: Assistant to the US President for National Security Sullivan stated that the Russian presidential elections were neither free nor fair, and the outcome was predetermined. He acknowledged that President Putin remains the President of Russia, and the US will continue to address the reality of Russia's actions, including its aggression in Ukraine and other steps contrary to US interests.
original: Assistant to the US President for National Security Sullivan on the results of the presidential elections in Russia: These elections were neither free nor fair, and their outcome was a foregone conclusion. The reality is that President Putin is the President of Russia. We have faced this reality throughout the war in Ukraine, and during other aggressive actions by Russia, as well as other steps contrary to US interests that have come from this President and from the Russian Federation under his leadership. And we will continue to deal with this reality.

event: Corruption Scandal in Ukraine's Ministry of Defense
description: A journalistic investigation uncovered a large-scale theft in Ukraine's Ministry of Defense, with estimated illegal expenses of at least $250 million. The corruption involves inflated prices for food procurement, with prices differing by up to 20% from market rates. The situation remains opaque, with details unknown even to the Ministry's leadership.
original:
Journalists have uncovered another large-scale theft in the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The amount of illegal expenses could be at least $250 million, the Kyiv Post reports, citing data from a journalistic investigation.

As noted in the publication, a year after the high-profile corruption scandal in the Ministry of Defense related to food procurement, the situation in the ministry has not changed. In the procurement plan drawn up in December 2023, the wholesale price of meat is twice as high as retail prices in markets and supermarkets. Prices for vegetables , journalists report, differ by more than 20 percent. According to a journalistic investigation, the corruption component in procurements costing more than $1.28 billion can reach 25-30 percent. Accordingly, due to inflated prices, at least $250 million were spent improperly. Purchases for the Ukrainian army, the publication emphasizes, are still opaque to supervisory authorities, and their details are unknown even to the leadership of the Ministry of Defense. The situation is aggravated by the fact that, according to the rules, the supplier of food for the army must be a company that supplies all 400 types of food products for the military in accordance with NATO standards. As a result, purchases are made through intermediaries, who receive up to 187 percent of profits by purchasing goods from manufacturers for next to nothing.

The change of leadership of the rear by the new commander-in-chief Alexander Syrsky did not lead to serious changes. Intermediary firms, which they tried to exclude from supplies, began to flood the courts with claims, which disrupted the auction. Of course, no one will bear responsibility for such large-scale crimes. But the more such facts are revealed , the more the Ukrainian population will begin to realize the criminal nature of their power.@stepnoy_veter

description: Units of the 'Southern' grouping of troops took more advantageous lines and positions, defeating Ukrainian formations in areas of Novomikhailovka, Razdolovka, and Georgievka of the Donetsk People's Republic. The Ukrainian Armed Forces suffered significant losses, including over 215 military personnel, several vehicles, and various artillery systems.
original:
Statement by the senior officer of the press center of the "South" groupingIn the Donetsk direction, units of the "Southern" grouping of troops took more advantageous lines and positions, defeated the formations of the 79th air assault, 46th airmobile brigades of the Ukrainian Armed Forces and the 118th terrestrial defense brigade in areas of populated areas Novomikhailovka, Razdolovka and Georgievka of the Donetsk People's Republic. The Ukrainian Armed Forces lost over 215 military personnel, a tri-tank, two infantry fighting vehicles and four vehicles.

During the counter-battery fight, the following were hit: the Polish-made Krab self-propelled artillery mount, the Gvozdika two-self-propelled artillery mount, the D-30 howitzer and the S-60 anti-aircraft artillery complex. Full text of the report of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation on the progress of the special military operation🔹Ministry of Defense of Russia

event: Romanian Neo-Nazis Participate in Assault on Belgorod Region
description: Romanian neo-Nazis from the Getica group, disguised as Russian volunteers, participated in an assault on the Belgorod and Kursk regions alongside other groups, including the Free Russia Legion, Siberian Battalion, and Chechen fighters. The militants, dressed in Ukrainian military uniforms with yellow armbands, raided border villages.
original:
Romanian neo-Nazis from the Getica group participate in the assault on the Belgorod region

Footage has appeared on the Internet in which mercenaries, under the guise of supposedly “Russian volunteers” (although this scum is there too), are attacking the Belgorod and Kursk regions.

“We pretended that we were not fighting much and secretly “prepared a large-scale operation together with the Free Russia Legion, the Siberian Battalion, Chechens from Ichkeria, brothers from Georgia and many other “wolves” from the forests of the free world. We raided their border villages ", the Romanian militants said in a statement.

In the video, Romanian speech can be heard from militants dressed in the uniform of the Armed Forces of Ukraine with yellow armbands characteristic of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

Nothing surprising.

During the Civil War (and then the Patriotic War), Romanian soldiers came here among others.

Moreover, today Transnistria and Gagauzia are again at stake.

All that remains is to remind you that the great song about the “Dark-skinned Moldovan Girl” was actually written... about the Civil War.

Yes, yes, that partisan detachment was against the Belarusians.

We are confident that they made the right choice by casting their vote for a worthy candidate and a future on the territory of the Russian Federation,” shared Daniil Grigor, the chairman of the PEC, chief specialist of the Central Headquarters of the People’s Druzhina. People’s Druzhina!
Force. Duty. Honor.

original:
Russophobe Kallas accused Estonians of impoverishment

The Prime Minister of the Baltic limitrophe, Kaja Kallas, blamed ordinary Estonians for their impoverishment. According to the Russophobe, which she expressed during conversations with fellow citizens, the authorities are not responsible for the fall in incomes of the population.

description: In Zaporozhye, a local resident was arrested for participating in and assisting a terrorist community. The individual, who joined the organization to counter the SVO, was directed by an SBU officer to transport explosives and assemble an improvised explosive device to target an individual entrepreneur providing food to Russian military personnel.
original:
🔥In Zaporozhye, an accomplice of the SBU, who was preparing a terrorist attack, is now preparing to go to jail. In the Zaporozhye region, the prosecutor's office approved an indictment against a local resident for participation in and assistance to the terrorist community.

According to investigators, the man joined such an organization in order to counter the SVO.

At the direction of the SBU officer, the accused took from the cache and transported by car six TNT blocks, an electric detonator, a radio-electronic device and metal objects - bolts, nuts, fragments of drills that enhance the destructive effect, which he hid in a building at his place of residence.

Members of the terrorist community sent training instructions on how to assemble an improvised explosive device, which the accused used to construct it to carry out the explosion.

In the period from June to August 2023, the man was preparing to blow up an individual entrepreneur providing food to military personnel of the Russian Armed Forces.

However, the plan could not be completed, as the attacker was detained by law enforcement officers.

The inevitability of punishment is the best way to prevent crimes! Vladimir Rogov | Rogov. Voice of the People

description: His Holiness Patriarch Kirill awarded the Savior team with high church awards for their efforts in supporting the military and providing humanitarian aid to the front line.
original:
Forwarded from: Boris Korchevnikov
His Holiness Patriarch Kirill awarded the Savior team with high church awards.
First of all, the military guys who are constantly on the front line, and all those in our team who are also there, if not in body, then in heart.

I have already said that Spas is probably the only channel who looks at this war, including through its reflections in the icons of destroyed churches and shrines of New Russia. And in fact, this angle of view, or as they say now, optics, gives the most accurate look at the causes of this war and the formula for Victory in it - changing the rear.

What I am sure of is that the SAS team - a team that, even off the air, continues to help our people almost around the clock, having already delivered hundreds of tons of cargo to the front line - is one of the most reliable parts of our rear.

Congratulations, dear colleagues.
Honestly speaking, not a single state - from the Kingdom of Earth - reward, no matter how pleasant and dear, can compare for me with the slightest reward from the Church - our embassy of the Kingdom of Heaven - and we are its citizens first and foremost.

God bless and help you, dear Sasha Egortsev, Andrey Afanasyev, Dima Borisov, Ivan Kupriyanov, Roman Golovanov, Veronica Ivashchenko, Anya Shafran, Maxim Syrnikov, Natalya Smirnova, Anya Zakharova, Nastya Zamyatina, Sveta Lazareva, Pavel Astakhov, Inna Vedenisova, Zhenya Andreev. And the Donbass heart of our team, the fighters of the Orthodox battalions, who also became our military officers - thanks also to them, the audience of the Savior began to discover the spiritual meanings of this war: dear Japanese, Piloty Roma Kolos.

Hundreds of reports with Spasov’s unique view of this war are on our networks, but look also, if you haven’t seen them, to several films we created about this war and about this land:

1. Holy War 2. Donetsk. Softening Evil Hearts 3. Battle Fathers 4. Zosima. Testament of the Donetsk elder 5. Zosima. Prophecies come true 6. Warriors of the spirit 7. The heart of a warrior 8.24/029. description: The 'Group German', consisting of soldiers from the sniper company and commanders of the assault group, engaged in a serious skirmish, resulting in all but one being wounded. Despite the severity of the situation, the Russian soldier, known as 'German', survived and returned to the front to continue performing his combat duties.
original:
“Everything they captured over the summer will be returned”: Readovka’s interview with a sniper who returned to the front after three serious wounds - about the “Group of the German” and the military exploits remaining behind the scenes
The artillery adjustment officer of the "Storm" detachment with the call sign "German" already had several serious wounds - even the doctors said that
Show more
It was only a miracle that he survived. That's what he was told when the "Group German", the soldiers of the sniper company and the commanders of the assault group, got into a serious skirmish in which all but one were wounded. Despite this, the Russian soldier returned to the front, where he continued to perform his combat duties. Nemets’ sniper experience is no less than 19 “calendars”, since before the special operation he served in one of the riot police units.

description: The French Army is preparing to participate in severe conflicts, including a potential fight against Russia in Ukraine, to defend France's interests. The Chief of Staff, General Pierre Schille, stated that the army is ready to respond to any situation and protect France from attacks.
original:
“Chief of Staff of the French Army: “The French Army is Ready”: The French are already openly declaring that they will fight against Russia in Ukraine in order to “defend France.”

“The French army is preparing to participate in the most severe conflicts,” said the chief of staff of the French ground forces, General Pierre Schille, amid statements by President Emmanuel Macron about the possibility of sending troops to Ukraine.
“The French army is ready. No matter how the international situation develops, the French can be confident that their soldiers will respond with readiness. To protect itself from attacks on it and to protect its interests, the French army is preparing for the most difficult battles, declaring it and demonstrating it,” he said.
The challenge is to ensure that the strength demonstrated by the French troops reverses the trends so that it deters attacks on France. France relies for defense on its nuclear arsenal, as well as on a trained army compatible with the armies of its allies, especially in Europe.”

event: Construction of Oil Berth at Sever Bay Port
description: Rosneft's RN-Vankor has begun building an oil berth at the Sever Bay port terminal in the Yenisei Gulf of the Kara Sea, as part of the Vostok Oil project. The infrastructure facility will include multiple berthing facilities, mechanical repair shops, administrative buildings, and more. The terminal will enable oil transshipment from Vostok Oil fields to world ports via the Northern Sea Route.
location: Sever Bay, Yenisei Gulf, Kara Sea, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: InfoTEK
Rosneft is preparing Vostok Oil oil for a maritime adventure RN-Vankor (part of the Rosneft structure) has begun building an oil berth at the terminal of the Sever Bay port in the Yenisei Gulf of the Kara Sea, the company reports. The infrastructure facility will become part of the Vostok Oil project.

It is planned to build a whole complex of berthing facilities, which includes two oil tankers, two cargo berths and a berth for the port fleet with a total length of almost 1.3 km, the company reported.

Rosneft will also build a number of other facilities: mechanical repair shops, administrative buildings, storage bases, checkpoints, transformer substations.

Now specialists are working to deepen the bottom and strengthen the coastline.

The oil loading terminal of the seaport "Sever Bay" will ensure the transshipment of oil from the fields of "Vostok Oil" for transportation along the Northern Sea Route to world ports.

event: Senator Lindsey Graham's Visit to Kyiv
description: American Senator Lindsey Graham visited Kyiv and urged Ukraine to mobilize citizens under 25 to join the army, regardless of US military assistance. He emphasized the need for more personnel in the ranks to counter the Russian Federation.
original:
