He also advised Ukrainians to go to war against the Russian Federation regardless of whether the United States continues to support Ukraine. description: A 'Terminator' tank support vehicle, equipped with 30 mm 2A42 automatic cannons and a 7.62 mm PKTM machine gun, destroyed a Ukrainian stronghold in the village of Tonenkoe. The vehicle's crew suppressed enemy fire, allowing assault groups to advance and take new positions.
original:
Forwarded from: Z 105th Regiment NM DPR: reports from LBS and more.
The crew of the "Terminator" (tank support vehicle) with rapid fire destroys a Nazi stronghold during an attack on the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the village of Tonenkoe. The footage was filmed on the northwestern outskirts of Tonenkoe, west of Avdeevka.

The weapons operator operates with 30 mm 2A42 automatic cannons and a 7.62 mm PKTM machine gun.

It is noteworthy that fire on Ukrainian Armed Forces positions is carried out at night. Because of this, it is difficult for the enemy to determine the direction of fire and use anti-tank weapons.

During the diversionary maneuver, the crew of the vehicle suppressed enemy fire, which allowed the assault groups to advance deeper into the village and take new positions.@polk105Avdeevka.Ru🇷🇺

“In connection with the ongoing aggressive war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which grossly violates the UN Charter, provokes numerous crises and undermines international food security, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs decided not to allow official representatives of the Russian Federation to participate in person, limiting it to the embassy level or online. description: The Center for Spatial Technologies (CST) has launched the 'Spatial Archive', a comprehensive study of the attack on the Mariupol Drama Theater, where hundreds of residents were hiding. The archive includes thousands of photos, videos, satellite images, and witness testimonies, providing a detailed account of the tragedy.
original:
☝️A site has been created with a study of the attack on the Mariupol Drama Theater 📲The Center for Spatial Technologies (CST) has launched the "Spatial Archive", where it has collected thousands of photos, videos, satellite images and publications on social networks about the tragedy of the Drama Theater. In addition, conversations with witnesses of the destruction of the building by the Russians, where hundreds of Mariupol residents were hiding, are presented.

The "Spatial Archive" consists of 10 video interviews with witnesses of the explosion, diagrams, visualizations and 3D models that give the research results a spatial dimension. Also on the site are three research texts with research results that talk about the role of the theater as a shelter and analyze the consequences of the attack. 😡The Russians are currently trying to hide the consequences of the bombing of the theater on March 16, 2022. First, they surrounded the theater with a construction curtain. And now the work on dismantling the building continues. Therefore, according to the organizers of the project, the materials are an important historical document testifying to the war crime of the Russians.

event: Residents of Avdeevka Escape to Yasinovataya
description: During the Ukrainian occupation, residents of Avdeevka risked their lives to escape to neighboring Yasinovataya in the DPR. They navigated through a single passage, avoiding tripwires and mines, and eventually made their way onto the highway or by bicycle.
original:
During the Ukrainian occupation, residents of Avdeevka, at the risk of their lives, managed to get out to neighboring Yasinovataya (DPR), said a resident of the liberated city, Nikolai.

“You couldn’t walk everywhere, at your own peril and risk. There was only one passage to Yasinovataya, but people managed to get blown up by tripwires and mines. And then you went onto the highway or rode a bicycle and you are in the DPR. And then they closed this path altogether,” he clarified.@donbassr🇷🇺

description: A 15-year-old resident of Gorlovka was mortally wounded by an anti-personnel mine, which was part of a Ukrainian armed formation's shelling of residential areas in the Donetsk People's Republic.
original:
👮‍♂️Ukrainian mine claimed the life of a child in Gorlovka

On March 18, a 15-year-old resident of Gorlovka was mortally wounded as a result of the detonation of an anti-personnel mine, cassettes with which Ukrainian armed formations were shelling residential areas of the Donetsk People's Republic.❗️Dear parents! Regularly remind children of the rules of behavior when detecting explosive objects! Remember that it is strictly forbidden to approach them, touch them, try to move them, or cover them with earth or sand. If explosive devices are triggered, the radius of scattering of destructive elements or fragments can be tens of meters.❗️Have a conversation with your children about how dangerous it is to walk on the grass and visit forested areas, especially in populated areas close to the line of combat contact.❗️They can also pose a deadly threat imagine explosive devices placed in various household items, such as souvenirs, toys, various containers (packaging), etc. It is necessary to refrain from using electrical and radio equipment near the find, and not to exert temperature, sound, mechanical or electromagnetic influence on the dangerous object in order to prevent an explosion.

If such objects are discovered, you must immediately report the find by calling 102 or 101 and try to prevent passers-by from entering the danger zone until representatives of the operational services arrive.

Press service of the Ministry of Internal Affairs
for the Donetsk People's Republic

description: A drunk man in the village of Razvetye, Kursk Region, shot at five Pomeranian dogs on his neighbor's property because they barked at him. Four dogs were found hiding, and one was left crippled after being shot in the spine. The owner filed a police report, but no criminal case was opened due to the lack of evidence.
original:
A man shot at five neighbors’ Spitz dogs in the village of Razvetye, Kursk Region. An aggressive drunk man opened fire with a gun at the Pomeranian dogs on his neighbor's property because they barked at him over the fence.

Returning home, the dogs' owner Roman saw a terrible picture: four pets were hiding in the area, and one was lying in blood. The wounded dog was taken to the veterinarian and rescued, but it was left crippled: a shot hit the spine, and the Spitz's hind legs gave out.

The owner of the dogs filed a statement with the police. But, he said, the police were unable to find the gun used to shoot the animals. The neighbor probably returned the gun to the friend from whom he took it. As a result, no criminal case was opened. Now Roman has turned to the prosecutor's office. And when he starts throwing himself at people, won't they find a gun either? In the Country. Subscribe

description: Russian manufacturer Navis, in collaboration with Kompan Marine, is developing an unmanned boat for hydrographic surveys, underwater structure inspections, environmental monitoring, and patrolling. The boat can carry a payload of up to 200 kg, including remote-controlled underwater and aerial vehicles, and operate in both remote control and fully autonomous modes.
original:
🕹A new project for an unmanned multi-purpose boat is being developed in Russia

The Russian manufacturer of automatic ship motion control systems Navis has begun developing an unmanned boat (UEC) in collaboration with the manufacturer of boats and yachts Kompan Marine.

The BEC will be created to carry out work on hydrographic survey of deep and shallow water areas, survey of underwater structures, cable and pipeline routes, for environmental monitoring and patrolling of the territory. Depending on the tasks, the boat is capable of carrying a payload of up to 200 kg, including a remote-controlled uninhabited underwater vehicle and an unmanned aerial vehicle.

The vessel is designed to perform a wide range of tasks both in remote control mode and in fully autonomous mode.@mediapaluba#back#newship

event: Road Repairs to Saur-Mogila Memorial Complex
description: The Ministry of Transport reported that major repairs are underway on the road to the Saur-Mogila memorial complex. Road workers are restoring sections of regional roads, including Manuylovka-Dmitrovka and Snezhnoye-Marinovka, with a total length of about 50 km. The repairs aim to ensure unimpeded passage to the memorial complex and the Marinovka automobile checkpoint.
original:
Major repairs of the road to the Saur-Mogila memorial complex are ongoing, the Ministry of Transport reported.

Road workers of the State Company "Avtodor" have resumed work on the regional roads Manuylovka - Dmitrovka and Snezhnoye - Marinovka, where sections with a total length of about 50 km are planned for restoration.

Currently, the roadside area within the right of way is being cleared, culverts are being reconstructed and the old road surface is being milled. In addition, road workers have begun to bring the width of traffic lanes to Russian standards.

After completion of work on these sections of roads, unimpeded passage from the settlement of Snezhnoye to the Marinovka automobile checkpoint, as well as to the Saur-Mogila memorial complex, will be ensured.

description: 16-year-old Amina Urusova disappeared in Karachay-Cherkessia on March 13. A video later surfaced online, where she accused her non-existent brother of rape. Her mother believes she may have fallen into a sect or is being forced to make false claims.
original:
Forwarded from: Sapa Caucasus
A girl who disappeared in Karachay-Cherkessia accused her non-existent brother of rape. For almost a week, the entire republic has been looking for 16-year-old Amina Urusova. The teenager disappeared on March 13, and on the 17th a video recorded by the girl herself appeared online. In the video, she claims that she and her mother had frequent conflicts, that her uncle “in the village” beat her, and that her “elder brother” even raped her. The girl’s mother is convinced that her daughter fell into some kind of sect and is now slandering the whole family. “I myself don’t understand what’s happening, in what company, what she’s under – I don’t understand at all. She doesn't have an older brother, so you understand. I don’t recognize my daughter,” Amina Asli’s mother told Sapa.

The woman assumes that someone is forcing the missing woman to say such things, or that someone was mocking her and now wants to discredit the family. “If there had been something like that, we definitely would not have contacted the authorities. I wouldn’t write to the authorities to look for her, I wouldn’t tell the public to look for her. But on the very first day of my disappearance, I reported it to the police,” the mother said. According to Sapa’s source, the Investigative Committee opened a criminal case for murder, and law enforcement officers continue to search for the teenager. According to our source, Amina worked in a pizzeria in Cherkessk. On the day of her disappearance, the girl went to work and never returned and stopped responding to messages. The teenager has no siblings, only her sister and cousins - they are all younger than her. Subscribe to Sapa Kavkaz|Give us your vote

You need to understand that a large family of Canadians does not kill, does not rape, does not dress in clothes that make identification difficult, does not insist on holding “maple syrup festivals,” does not create terrorist cells, does not waste budget funds, and does not do all that who are left behind rather than deported.

Obviously, such behavior on the part of the Canadian family contradicts the ideology of multinationality and “friendship of peoples.”

description: Experts attributed the high level of trust in Vladimir Putin in the Khabarovsk Territory to the successful implementation of social and infrastructure projects, which have brought stability to the region. Over 80% of voters supported Putin, with a turnout of almost 65%, a record figure in the region's modern political history.
original:
Experts called the high level of trust in Vladimir Putin in the Khabarovsk Territory natural. The flair of “oppositionism” that they tried to impose on the region will finally be thrown off. People made a choice in favor of the development vector set by the President of Russia and implemented by the governor of the Khabarovsk Territory. More than 80% of the votes for Vladimir Putin with a turnout of almost 65% is a record figure, experts unanimously emphasize. “This is the first time in the modern political history of the region. In the Khabarovsk Territory, special conditions were created within the framework of this election cycle, taking into account the opposition background that the new team received in 2020,” notes political scientist Pavel Nalivaiko.

Director of the Center for Political Analysis Pavel Danil is confident that in the Khabarovsk Territory the elections were even calmer and more organized than in other regions: “People voted for Putin because the President for them is the personification of hope and the course the country is moving, the personification of the country’s security guarantees, sovereignty of the country. This is certainly a success for the residents of the region who made their choice. And this choice corresponds to the choice that Russian citizens make as a whole.” Viktor Poturemsky, director of political analysis at INSOMAR, compared the current results of the presidential election with a similar campaign in 2018: “Let me remind you that then the result was almost 66%, and now it is more than 80%. This allows us to say that the Khabarovsk Territory has gotten rid of its protest image and is moving into the category of regions where political stability flourishes.” And stability, according to commentators, was achieved through painstaking work to implement large social and infrastructure projects. People see its results and, accordingly, trust the authorities.hab.mk.ruExperts explained the record level of support for Putin in the Khabarovsk Territory. The most discussed topic of the coming spring was the election of the President of the Russian Federation. In the Khabarovsk Territory, as throughout the country, citizens from March 15 to 17 are actively...

description: The Center for Combating Disinformation and Ukrinform released the 14th issue of the Kramatorsk Station project, featuring an interview with National Guard soldier Dmytro Kurylovich, aka 'Drongo', who has been serving since 2014. The discussion covered motivation, mobilization, and service improvement in the army, as well as the current situation at the front.

description: Russian scientists from Novosibirsk State University, Novosibirsk State University of Architecture and Civil Engineering, and Tuva Institute of Integrated Development of Natural Resources developed a technology to recycle concrete waste. The method involves processing cement-sand stone crumbs into an active colloidal additive using mechano-chemical activation, allowing for energy-saving processing of construction waste into new building materials.
original:
Russian scientists have developed a technology for recycling concrete. Every year, up to 2.5 billion tons of construction waste are generated on the planet. In Russia, the problem of recycling this waste has become especially urgent due to its accumulation during the demolition of buildings built in the middle of the last century.

Part of the waste concrete crushing products is reused as coarse and fine aggregate in new concrete mixtures. However, up to 20% of the residue in the form of a fine powder fraction of cement-sand stone is not disposed of. It is either simply buried or used for dumping.

The creators of the advanced method were specialists from the Novosibirsk State University, the Novosibirsk State University of Architecture and Civil Engineering and the Tuva Institute of Integrated Development of Natural Resources of the SB RAS.

The new technology proposes to process cement-sand stone crumbs into an active colloidal additive using the method of mechano-chemical activation in a slightly alkaline aqueous solution. You don't even need special equipment for this.

The method created by Russian scientists will allow the use of energy-saving technologies for processing construction waste, including this valuable powder, into new types of building materials in order to save resources.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

Teleconferences between graduates of higher military educational institutions and cadets of their military universities have become regular. This gives cadets the opportunity to communicate directly with experienced military personnel, and the teaching staff to adjust their training based on the experience of the military district.

He also mentioned that France has prepared for 20,000 personnel in mobile brigades.

Forwarded from: Militarist
On French television they are already discussing where exactly French troops could be stationed in Ukraine

When asked by the TV presenter, wouldn’t the very fact of deploying ground troops along the Dnieper, even if we say “we won’t shoot first,” be considered by Russia as a provocation?

Colonel Colonel Vincent Arbaretier, who was invited to the studio as an expert, replied: “Absolutely not, because this would mean forcing Russia to discuss from a position of equality.”

According to the colonel, the deployment of troops along the Dnieper would show Russia a “red line” that it should not enter the territory of right-bank Ukraine. And placement along the border with Belarus would secure Kyiv.

Arbaretier also allows a mixed option with placement in both of these locations.

“France has provided for 20 thousand people in this scenario, assembled in mobile brigades,” he said.

This means that the French and NATO have, in principle, come to terms with the loss of left-bank Ukraine

description: A new record has been set in the BD zone, with 985 Russian vehicles destroyed since the beginning of March. This surpasses the previous record of 939 units in February. The Russian military is forced to use non-military equipment due to a shortage of armored fighting vehicles, making them more vulnerable to damage.
original:
It’s March 19th, and a new, absolute record has already been set in the category of destroyed Russian vehicles in the BD zone.

Since the beginning of March, 985 units have been destroyed.

Let me remind you that the previous record in this category was set in February - 939 units. In general, starting from December 2023, vehicles are losing the maximum amount of ROV from month to month for the entire time of the full-scale invasion.

I note that these loss figures are related to the previously off-scale losses of armored fighting vehicles. Due to the shortage and shortage of specialized, armored equipment for carrying out assault activities, the ROV is forced to use non-military type equipment, both not adapted for combat operations, and much easier to be rendered unusable by light damage.

This is precisely one of the reasons for such indicators, which will continue to grow, since the Russian military-industrial complex is not able to solve the problem of the shortage of armored fighting vehicles through its own production/restoration.

event: Idealists and Heroes in Modern Russian Literature
description: Author Dmitry Konanykhin will discuss his novels and the concept of idealists and heroes in modern Russian literature at the exhibition-forum 'Russia' in Moscow's VDNKh on March 24.
original:
⚡️⚡️⚡️❗️❤️🇷🇺"Idealists and heroes in modern Russian literature." In dialogue with Dmitry Konanykhin, Anastasia Dyakova. In my opinion, I came up with an excellent title for a conversation about modern Russian literature as part of the exhibition RUSSIA (Moscow, VDNKh) at the venue Gazprom on Sunday, March 24). Be sure to come! Waiting for you!

The official press release sounds like this:🔹When: March 24 (Sun)🔹Time: 13 o’clock🔹Where: pavilion F (Gazprom), exhibition-forum “Russia” (VDNKh, Moscow)🔹Registration via the link is required: https:// pao-gazprom.timepad.ru/event/2816230/Leader of the meeting:
Anastasia Dyakova, journalist, TV presenter, director, producer, author of a speech course.

In Russian classical and modern independent Russian literature, there are characters who are distinguished by their ability to dream and think differently than everyone else, and to do things differently than everyone else.
They are very conventionally considered to be “idealists and heroes.”

Who are the idealists and heroes of our recent past and present?
In Dmitry's novels these are simple rural teachers, joiners, carpenters, Leningrad professors and many other Russian people.
These are simple stories about ordinary people, in the form of novels, combined into a single narrative about the strengths of our people.
There is a lot of personal content in these stories.

At the meeting, Dmitry will talk about his 4 novels, published in 2022 and 2023, and why, after the novel “Grandfathers and Great-Grandfathers” about the generation of heroes of the Great Patriotic War, the trilogy “Idealists” appeared about the generation of builders of the Great Country - a saga about childhood, youth and growing up. Who in our modern Russian literature are the heirs of classical Russian and Soviet literature - prose and poetry.

The “Idealists” trilogy is represented by the novels “Indians and Schoolchildren”, “Students and Adults” and “The Thin Green Line”. Note that each book can be read as an independent work.

The event takes place as part of the educational project “Book Lighthouses Visiting Gazprom.”

Watch online: https://vk.com/video-195576129_456239862 About the author:
Dmitry Konanykhin graduated from the Bauman Moscow Higher Technical School, participated in the design of space rocket refueling systems for the Plesetsk cosmodrome, the Indian space program, the Sea Launch joint space launch with the United States, the Russian Angara rocket in Plesetsk and the Far East.
Author and presenter of the daily popular science program “Russian Radio University” of Radio Russia, where he invites leading Russian scientists to talk about how the future of Russia is being created - more than 1250 episodes have already been published.

In 2016, he became a laureate of the federal Gorky Literary Prize in the “Russian Life” category: the novel “Grandfathers and Great-Grandfathers” was awarded for the connection between generations and the development of the traditions of the Russian epic novel.

The Book Lighthouses of Russia festival was held for the first time in 2020 and has become traditional during this time. The event brings together book lovers from all over the country and the world twice a year – in winter and autumn. The festival brings together book lovers, libraries, publishing houses, bookstores and all people who support books. Also, the mission of the organizers is to jointly form cultural immunity in an unstable world.#Rodnayarechpao-gazprom.timepad.ruIdealists and heroes in modern Russian literature / Events on TimePad.ruWho are they, idealists and heroes of our recent past and present? The author of the novels Dmitry Konanykhin will answer.

The teams are composed of real Russian men who, having cast aside fear and doubts, enter into a long-awaited fight. "A real battle is unfolding on the battlefield. More than fifty daredevils came to the village of Krivtsovo-Plota to take part in a fist fight. The battle takes place in a wall-to-wall format , in accordance with all traditions. Only if earlier the fighters wore a hat and gloves, now they are wearing helmets and boxing gloves,” correspondent Vladislav Kharchenko said. Especially for this battle, local craftsmen sewed T-shirts for the fighters. Each one has a unique logo with elements of national symbols and the image of a real Russian hero.

description: Two associates of Putin, Lantratova and Varlamova, forcibly deported two Ukrainian children, a newborn girl and a two-year-old boy, from the Kherson region to Moscow under the guise of medical treatment. The investigation found no physical disabilities in the children and fictitious documents were used to justify the deportation.
original:
The SBU reported suspicions to two associates of Putin, who deported Ukrainian children to Moscow.

The extras are part of Putin's close circle and are involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children from the temporarily occupied regions of our country.

According to the investigation, during the occupation of Kherson, the perpetrators forcibly took two minor pupils of the local Children's Home to Russia.

We are talking about a newborn girl and a two-year-old boy.

In order to "examine" the children before deportation, Lantratova and Varlamova arrived at the regional center under the guise of an "official visit" by representatives of the aggressor country.

Then they visited the city orphanage, from which two children were taken to Moscow, supposedly for recovery in Russian medical institutions.

In fact, the investigation established that the deported children had no physical disabilities and did not require medical intervention.

After the de-occupation of Kherson, law enforcement officers searched the Children's House, where they found fictitious documents regarding the deportation of minors to the Russian Federation with the signatures of Lantratova and Varlamova.

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service notified both defendants of suspicion under part 2 of Art. 28, Part 1 of Art. 438 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (violation of the laws and customs of war, forced individual or mass resettlement or deportation of persons under protection from the occupied territory to the territory of the occupying state, committed by a group of persons following a prior conspiracy).

Since the perpetrators are on the territory of the aggressor country, comprehensive measures are being taken to bring them to justice.

The investigation was conducted by employees of the Security Service under the procedural guidance of the Prosecutor General's Office.

Putin more as president, but we will negotiate with him. The question then is, who is he to them if he doesn’t have the necessary legitimacy? And what is the price for such negotiations?
And all this is due to shameful weakness,” Medvedev wrote in his Telegram channel. “The faces of Pindostan” are even more arrogant. They are openly waging a hybrid war against Russia. “And then they say in plain sight: we want to resume the strategic dialogue on arms. No really. This is the same as negotiating with Hitler about lowering the threshold of offensive weapons during the Great Patriotic War,” Medvedev emphasized. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Western defense ministers met to discuss the ongoing support for Ukraine. Ukraine's priority is the supply of long-range missiles, specifically German missiles, as Anglo-French ones have not brought success. The meeting also touched on the issue of shells, which remains unresolved. The US views its aid to Ukraine as an investment in Western security.

For the West? No. Only for the Kyiv tent.

They need German missiles. The Anglo-French ones do not bring success. Some things are spoiled, some people are killed, but success still goes to the Russians - in front, and to the West - Ukraine.

Of course, the same problems with shells will be discussed again. The shells are discussed, but do not grow. But it will definitely work out someday. In the meantime, let's discuss it for the twentieth time.

Americans just want to invest. They called in the new Kyiv embezzler minister to tell him, without euphemisms: “Help to the Armed Forces of Ukraine is an investment in our Western security.”

And to the Kyiv crooks - if only there were more victims. They like to give out orders to kill. This is their finest hour. In the past, ready to ride naked for fees, they are suddenly the rulers of other people’s lives and deaths...” (read the full text here) Subscribe to “Paragraph. Opinions"

event: Destruction of S-300 Air Defense System
description: Russian troops launched missile strikes on the S-300 air defense system position area in Kramatorsk, destroying the radar station and damaging the launcher. The strike resulted in the detonation of the launcher, killing 4 crew members and injuring 5 others. Additionally, the blast wave and shrapnel damaged all-terrain military vehicles and injured 5 National Guard personnel.
original:
In Kramatorsk, the S-300 air defense system was destroyed. Around noon, Russian troops launched missile strikes on the position area of the air defense system on the territory of Slag Mountain LLC "Kramatorsk Ferroalloy Plant", reports Donbass Partizan. The strike destroyed the radar station of the S-300 air defense system and damaged the launcher, which, as a result, received damage and detonated (explosions were heard by city residents with an interval of 7-12 minutes). 4 crew members of the complex were destroyed and 5 were injured of varying degrees of severity. In addition, all-terrain military vehicles were damaged by the blast wave and shrapnel and 5 military personnel of the National Guard of Ukraine who were on the territory of the Chevron service station (regularly used by the Ukrainian military for diagnostics) were injured. repair and maintenance of vehicles).

Strikes on the territory of Slag Mountain were carried out repeatedly before, but it was only this time that they managed to “catch” the air defense system complex.

description: Switzerland is considering introducing a temporary war tax to address financial holes in the federal budget. The tax, a one percentage point increase in VAT over six years, aims to raise 20 billion francs to finance the expansion of the Swiss army.
original:
Forwarded from: Unofficial Bezsonov
In “neutral” Switzerland they are considering introducing a “temporary war tax”

Huge financial holes have been discovered in the Swiss federal budget - the country lacks from 3.8 to 5.2 billion francs per year.

But government spending is too high and growing faster than revenue. At the same time, the country continues to pour billions of dollars and millions of euros alternately into Ukraine. Therefore, the Swiss want to finance the planned expansion of their peaceful pacifist army with a temporary targeted increase in VAT of one percentage point over six years.

It is expected that the new “war tax” could bring an additional 20 billion francs into the federal treasury.

From whom the Swiss authorities are going to defend themselves is a rhetorical question. But they plan to do this, apparently in the shortest possible time.

By the way, this practice is not new for the country. War taxes were introduced in Switzerland during the First and Second World Wars.@NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

description: The Ministry of Education and Science has ordered schools to reduce staff to match the number of students. This will mainly affect small institutions in the suburbs and schools with fewer than 200-300 students, resulting in the dismissal of management and support personnel, including school psychologists.
original:
This coming summer, an impressive number of schools will reduce their staff. From August 2024, the staff in schools must correspond to the number of students at the institution.

This was announced by the deputy head of the Main Directorate of Education, Youth and Sports of the Chisinau City Hall, Andrei Pavaloi, noting that this is an order of the Ministry of Education and Science, which will especially affect small institutions.

This will happen mainly in the suburbs, but also in some schools in the municipality with fewer than 200-300 students, Pavaloi said at a meeting of heads of municipal services.

According to the official, at the country level the situation is worse than in Chisinau. Directors of educational institutions will have to relieve their positions primarily of management personnel, as well as support personnel, including school psychologists.

Heads of educational institutions will have to break off working relationships with a significant part of the employees of these institutions, Andrei Pavaloi added. Notebook MoldovaNotepad MoldovaThis coming summer, an impressive part of schools will reduce their staff. This is an order of the Ministry of Education

description: A Nigerian court has ordered Binance to provide data on all Nigerian traders to the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) amid a terrorism financing investigation. The EFCC is investigating alleged money laundering and terrorist financing activities on the cryptocurrency exchange platform.
original:
A Nigerian court has ordered Binance to hand over data to anti-corruption agency amid a terrorism financing investigation. The Federal High Court in Abuja has ordered Binance Holdings Limited to provide the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) with details and information on all Nigerian traders on its platform.

Justice Emeka Nwite made the interim order after ruling on an ex-parte motion brought by EFCC lawyer Ekele Iheanacho.

According to the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN), the interim order was issued to allow the anti-corruption agency to investigate alleged money laundering and terrorist financing activities on Binance, a cryptocurrency exchange platform.

In addition, we will send with the guys the “cats” they need to carry out combat missions, which will be made by the craftsmen of the People’s Regiments.

description: The construction of a high-speed railway in Veliky Novgorod is expected to increase the city's population by more than two times, improve transport accessibility, and boost tourist flows and economic growth. The regional government anticipates new job opportunities and increased investment.
original:
The construction of a high-speed railway (HSR) will help increase the population of Veliky Novgorod by more than two times, said the governor of the Novgorod region Andrei Nikitin. We will have a HSR built. This will greatly change the transport accessibility of the region. From a region on the sidelines, the Novgorod region will turn into a region on the most important transport route of our country. These are not only opportunities, but also new challenges. For example, by 2035 or earlier, about 500 thousand people will live in the city. This suggests that we need a new general plan,” Nikitin noted.

According to him, thanks to the high-speed railway, an increase in tourist flows and an improvement in the economic situation are also expected.

The regional government added that improving transport accessibility always becomes a driver of development. Therefore, new jobs will appear in the city and the volume of investment will increase.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: British Troops May Participate in Ukraine Conflict
description: Ex-British Defense Minister Ben Wallace hinted that British troops may participate in the conflict in Ukraine, stating that uncertainty is part of deterrence and that they need to keep their enemy guessing about their actions.

British troops may have to participate in the conflict in Ukraine. This development of events was allowed by ex-British Defense Minister Ben Wallace, writes the Daily Mail.

"I think we should use expressions like 'we're not ruling it out.' After all, uncertainty is part of deterrence. We need to keep our enemy guessing about how far we will go and what we are ready for,” he said.

Wallace called for setting a minimum level of defense spending at 3% of GDP.

description: Russian forces, despite facing difficulties, advanced west of Avdeevka and captured Orlovka, gaining control of the settlement. This strategic move enables them to strike and advance south of Semyonovka, supporting Berdychi, which is under heavy pressure from the enemy.

Avdeevka direction: liberation of Orlovka situation on March 19, 2024 Russian forces, despite all the difficulties, continue to advance west of Avdeevka.

— According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, Orlovka came under the full control of Russian forces. The clearing of the settlement was completed at least by the morning of March 17, but the delay in communication was due to repelling enemy counterattacks and consolidation of occupied positions.

“With the capture of the village, the Russian forces have the opportunity not only to strike, but also to advance south of Semyonovka, with the support of which the enemy is putting strong pressure on Berdychi, where heavy fighting is also taking place.

Accordingly, this will affect the ability to stabilize the northern flank of the offensive west of Avdeevka, which is under the threat of an enemy attack from Novobakhmutovka, and subsequently liberate Berdychi, and possibly Semyonovka.

However, further advance of the Russian Armed Forces to the west in this area is not very rational. To the west, the enemy is building a line of defense with an emphasis on natural obstacles in the form of heights and rivers, and to the north is the Ocheretinsky fortified area, which to advance without advancing in the Gorlovka region is, if not suicidal, then an extremely difficult task. @rybar

description: The Federal Security Service of Russia in the Altai Territory detained a local resident born in 1976 for promoting anti-Russian content on a Telegram channel, encouraging terrorist activities and providing resource support to banned pro-Ukrainian terrorist organizations.

Another Bandera fan was detained in Altai.

The Federal Security Service of Russia in the Altai Territory suppressed the illegal terrorist activities of a local resident.

Citizen born in 1976 purposefully created and administered a public telegram channel, filling it with anti-Russian content in order to encourage the general public to engage in terrorist activities.

In particular, a number of materials contain calls for providing resource support to pro-Ukrainian terrorist organizations banned on the territory of the Russian Federation, which is confirmed by the results of linguistic examinations.

A criminal case has been initiated against the man under Part 2 of Art. 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (public calls for terrorist activities committed using the Internet).

He has been charged. At the request of the investigator, the court took the man into custody.

description: The Pacific Fleet hosted ceremonial events to mark Submariner Day at its base in Vladivostok. The celebrations began with the raising of St. Andrew's flags and flags of color on submarines. A memorial ceremony was held at the 'Battle Glory of the Pacific Fleet' memorial, where flowers were laid and a minute of silence was observed to honor deceased submariners.
original:
The Pacific Fleet hosted ceremonial events dedicated to Submariner Day at its base in Vladivostok.

According to tradition, the holiday began with the ceremonial raising of St. Andrew's flags and flags of color on submarines at their bases in Vilyuchinsk and Vladivostok.

On Korabelnaya Embankment in the capital of Primorye, the Commander of the Pacific Fleet, Admiral Viktor Liina, together with veteran Navy submariners and military personnel of the Pacific Fleet submarine formation, took part in a memorial ceremony of laying flowers at the Eternal Flame at the “Battle Glory of the Pacific Fleet” memorial. The dead submariners were honored with a minute of silence.

In the afternoon, a traditional concert in honor of the professional holiday, performed by artists of the Fleet Song and Dance Ensemble, is planned for military personnel of the Pacific Fleet submarine formation, their families and Navy veterans in the House of Fleet Officers.⚓️t.me/TOF_VMF

description: On March 19, 1906, Emperor Nicholas II signed a decree recognizing submarines as a separate class of warships, officially establishing the submarine forces of the Russian fleet.
original:
Day of the Submariner of Russia On March 19, Russia celebrates the Day of the Submariner. It was established by order of the Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy F.N. Gromov dated July 15, 1996 “On the introduction of annual holidays and professional days in the specialty.”

The celebration is associated with a specific historical event. On March 19 (March 6, O.S.), 1906, a decree was issued signed by Emperor Nicholas II, in which the head of the empire identified submarines as a separate class of warships; 10 submarines were included in the Russian fleet. This day is considered the official date of birth of the submarine forces of the Russian fleet.@brd_nash

event: EU Imposes Duty on Grain Imports
description: The European Commission is set to impose a duty of 95 euros per ton on grain imports from Russia and Belarus, which will lead to a price increase of at least 50%. This move may also be accompanied by additional duties on oilseeds and their processed products.
original:
The European Commission may in the coming days impose a duty of 95 euros per ton on grain imports from Russia and Belarus, writes the Financial Times, citing informed sources.

This will lead to a price increase of at least 50%, sources said.

In addition, the European Commission may introduce additional duties on the supply of oilseeds and their processed products.

In 2023, Russia supplied the EU with 4 million tons of these products, which corresponds to approximately 1% of total European demand, FT notes. Photo: Alexander Reka/TASS@interfaxonline

event: Threat of Deportation of Canadian Family
description: A large Canadian family, the Rent Feinstras, who moved to Russia to escape Western values, faces deportation due to difficulties with the Russian language test. Despite human rights activists' intervention, the family may be forced to leave Russia and wait three months before reapplying for a tourist visa.
location: Nizhny Novgorod, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
“We will no longer be allowed to return”: A large family from Canada is again under threat of deportation
A long-suffering large family of migrants from Canada cannot “crack” the hard nut of the Nizhny Novgorod migration service. This region was chosen by the Rent Feinstra family with eight children
Show more
to move away from Western perverts and juvenile justice. They sold all their real estate in Canada, gathered their children and moved to Russia to farm on Russian soil. But it was not there.
In the Nizhny Novgorod region, which actively receives migrants from Transcaucasia and Central Asia, for some reason they have created many obstacles for migrants from Canada. They were about to be deported, but human rights activists intervened. And here's another hitch. Because of the Russian language test. It must be taken while the short-term tourist visa is valid. In two months. A family cannot learn our difficult language so quickly. The threat of forced deportation arose again.
“As far as I know, we will no longer be allowed to return, we will not be able to apply for residency again for another three months. We will have to go to another country and wait until we can apply for a new tourist visa again to come back and try again,” laments the head of the family.
Feinstra's biggest worry is that the money raised is gradually disappearing. And a considerable part of it will be spent on tickets back to Canada, and then to Russia for the exam - almost half a million dollars for the whole family!
Deputy Alexander Khinshtein promised to intervene in the situation. In a conversation with the Nizhny Novgorod governor, the following idea arose - if the family does not pass the test, they will be provided with temporary asylum while they learn the Russian language.
It would seem that Russia needs such people; those who are tired of Western threats to large heterosexual families and are looking for a new country to move to in order to build a future there should look up to them. But it seems that some officials absolutely do not need such new Russians.

description: A company responsible for repairing the Nekrasovsky overpass's sidewalk, handrails, and pedestrian fencing has been fined 6 million rubles and had their contract terminated due to poor quality and untimely completion of work. The municipal road service will now complete the repairs.
original:
Forwarded from: SHESTAKOV ONLINE
A fine of 6 million rubles, inclusion in the register of unscrupulous suppliers and termination of the contract awaits the company that carried out repairs on the Nekrasovsky overpass. Last year they had to repair the sidewalk on the Nekrasovsky overpass, install new handrails, and put the pedestrian fencing in order. To date, the work has not been completed. For several months, the city administration has been pursuing claims with the contractor. We see that there are no prospects for completion of obligations on the part of the contractor, so we impose a fine on him in the amount of six million rubles for poor quality and untimely completion of work, we terminate the contract and prepare documents to include the company in the register of unscrupulous suppliers. The municipal road service has been entrusted with completing the repair of the sidewalk on the Nekrasovsky overpass "Maintenance of urban areas." Now they have to purchase all the necessary materials, agree on a schedule and then start work.@vl_sgt

On March 18, Nikolai Shoya from the village of Ponizovka left home and did not return. This was reported by the LisaAlert search and rescue team.

Nikolai Danilovich was born in 1937, 160 centimeters tall, of normal build with gray hair and green eyes. He was wearing a dark blue jacket, dark blue sweatpants and black galoshes.

event: EU Secretly Preparing for Ukraine's Accession
description: The European Union is secretly planning for Ukraine's accession, along with Moldova and some Western Balkan Peninsula countries. The EU is keeping this expansion quiet due to economic collapse and large-scale farmer protests.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
The European Union is secretly preparing for the accession of Ukraine—Politico. Also, the accession of Moldova and some countries of the Western Balkan Peninsula is planned.

Now the EU is not talking about the upcoming expansion publicly due to the collapse of the economy and large-scale protests by farmers.

This is the EU, and how well it all started...
